titleStmt.title: J. B. Ward et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5977

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlet, Governor, of Kentucky; we petitioners Citizens of the County of car -- Carter; and part of the Jury sumoned from, Carter County to Lawrence, at the fall term of the Court, in October 1859, and being the trial of said Endic of Gabriel. Endicott for murder, we found him Guilty of Manslaughter, and fixed his time of Confinement at ten years; said Endicott has now been confine little more than half the term; has been a faithfull, prisoner is a young man, of standing, and Moral worth; all things connected with his case; and himself considered; we hope will induce, your Excelly to act
over,
favorably, in his case, and pardon, him from the balance of his time,

and as in duty will ever & c,
Petitioners Names
J. B. Ward
William Everman
Samuel Everman
Elijah Horton
John Grizzell
O. M Harper
James. W. Scott.
James McGlone
